availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Golding (Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Amanda Golding. Father of Margaret J. Golding, Mary R. Golding, John M. Golding, Susan F. Golding, Nancy A. Golding, Calvin V. Golding, Sarah E. Golding, William A. Golding, and Judith J. Golding. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860. Justice of the Peace in Pendleton County in 1864.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 93; KYR-0001-007-0320.
